summary.p: Thanks for all the good that Bullinger has shown to his sons, and asks for further help, especially for Hector, who is in great distress.

div.p: My friendly greetings and all the best beforehand.

Dear sir, I have understood (heard, learned) how you have shown so much goodness to my sons and especially now to my son Hector in his needs and concerns. For this, I thank you most highly for all the good you have ever shown them, and I kindly ask you to continue to be helpful and advisory to them, especially to my son Hector now in his needs and concerns. I will always strive, along with my sons, to deserve this from you, willingly found with our body and goods.
Dated Constance, on the fourteenth day of June in the year etc. in the 37th.
To the well-learned Master Heinrich Bullinger, preacher in Zurich, my dear and good friend, to be delivered.
